definition: to stop/to halt
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: You've done enough, you may stop there.
sentences.chinese: 你已經做得很夠了，可以就此打住。

sentences.english: Excuse me while I pack for California.
sentences.chinese: 我要整理行裝前往加利福尼亞，不好意思就此打住。

sentences.english: All right, so, we'll try some things.
web browsing, but I would hold off if you want something more reliable.
And while I could have ended there I had no desire to.
sentences.chinese: 也許我可以在這裏結束，但是，我還不想就此打住。

sentences.english: Our love, stop, who also don't care who.
sentences.chinese: 我們的愛情，就此打住，誰乜不用再在乎誰。
我的運氣並未就此打住。

sentences.english: He stopped and turned away angrily to light his cigar.
sentences.chinese: 他打住話頭，氣憤地轉過身去點着雪茄。

sentences.english: and you're just ready to throw it all to the floor and forget about it.
sentences.chinese: 你們已經準備就此打住，把這事束之高閣了。

sentences.english: Those lacking senses of humour should probably not read on.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏幽默感的讀者可以就此打住，無需繼續閱讀。

sentences.english: I paused remembering the gun pointed at him.
sentences.chinese: 我打住話頭，想起劫匪用槍指着他的情景。

definition: to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
subject (under discussion)/thread (of an argument)
to stop at this point/to end here/to call it a day
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
one's proper business
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
to hold one's tongue/Shut up!
shut up/shut your mouth/stop talking
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
to make a long story short (idiom)
tactful/discreet
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
